ygData.subject: Re: Bards questing
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh, One of the things that Brad said to me at GenCon last summer was: (talking about building new things, crossing new frontiers...) and the competition does
ygData.messageBody:
Heh,

One of the things that Brad said to me at GenCon last summer was:

(talking about building new things, crossing new frontiers...) "and the
competition does not offer seminars in what they have learned...."

So, maybe it's a matter of timing. EQ was 3 years of development from start
to release. Maybe at the time Verant could have used it most - which
certainly would have been early on - UO/Origin was not
holding/giving/offering "seminars." And running one is a different subject
from designing/building, etc.

Sylly

----- Original Message -----
From: <kim@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, February 18, 2000 12:46 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bards questing


> One of the comments Designer Dragon (Raph Koster, UO lead
> designer) made to me was that Origin was offering seminars
> sharing what they'd learned about running a commercial MMORPG.
> Verant was not one of the companies which signed up to attend.
